intro: Silene birgittae, commonly known as the Birgit's campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. Silene birgittae is a perennial herb with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its botanical features make it an attractive and rare species found in specific ecological niches.
